answers.answer: A normal pregnancy should last about 40 weeks. Occasionally, labor may begin prematurely before the 37th week of pregnancy because uterine contractions cause the cervix to open earlier than normal. When this happens, the baby is born premature and can be at risk for health problems. Fortunately, due to research, technology and medicine, the health of premature babies is improving.What risk factors place me at a high risk for premature labor?Certain factors may increase a woman's risk of having premature labor, although the specific causes of premature labor are not known. However, having a specific risk factor does not mean a woman is predetermined to have premature labor. A woman may have premature labor for no apparent reason. If you have any of these risk factors, it's important to know the symptoms of premature labor and what you should do if they occur.* Women are at greatest risk for premature labor if:o They are pregnant with multipleso They have had a previous premature birtho They have certain uterine or cervical abnormalities* Medical risk factors include:o Recurring bladder and/or kidney infectionso Urinary tract infections, vaginal infections, and sexually transmitted infectionso Infection with fever (greater than 101 degrees F) during pregnancyo Unexplained vaginal bleeding after 20 weeks of pregnancyo Chronic illness such as high blood pressure, kidney disease or diabeteso Multiple first trimester abortions or one or more second trimester abortionso Underweight or overweight before pregnancyo Clotting Disorder (thrombophilia)o Being Pregnant with a single fetus after in vitro fertilization (IVF)o Short time between pregnancies (less than 6-9 months between birth and beginning of the next pregnancy)* Lifestyle risks for premature labor include:o Little or no prenatal careo Smokingo Drinking alcoholo Using illegal drugso Domestic violence, including physical, sexual or emotional abuseo Lack of social supporto High levels of stresso Low incomeo Long working hours with long periods of standing
